node.title: Z Energy blames NZTA's bitumen import plans for market exit
node.description: The shutdown of Marsden Point oil refinery is causing ructions in the road building industry which is already under intense pressure.

node.title: Doctor who worked on Moderna vaccine cements her place in history
node.description: Dr. Kizzmekia Corbett is being celebrated for leading a team at the National Institutes of Health that helped develop Moderna's COVID-19 vaccine.

node.title: Minnesota hotline works to improve mental health of small farmers
node.description: In the last two decades, more than 100,000 small farms have disappeared in America — which has had a devastating effect on the mental health of farmers.

node.title: Police and Parliament on alert for more protest action

node.title: Judge orders New York's congressional map to be redrawn
node.description: The proposed map would have created 22 Democratic seats and 4 Republican seats.

node.title: Banks' handling of home loan applications stirs protests

node.title: Doctor warns tough flu season ahead and NZ is 'particularly vulnerable'
node.description: A prominent doctor says the flu season could be particularly bad this year because the country has far lower natural immunity. Audio

node.title: NZX Top 50 companies well-placed as interest rates set to rise - report
node.description: Many of the country's biggest businesses have spent the last two years ensuring they are in a strong position, says Chapman Tripp finance partner Cathryn Barber.

node.title: Challenged ballots leave outcome in doubt of Amazon union vote in Alabama
node.description: The initial count showed a majority voted against unionization, a close election with about 52% of returned ballots coming in favor of joining RWDSU.

node.title: Major pharmacies now offering second booster shots
node.description: Eligible individuals can either schedule appointments online or walk into pharmacies for same-day jabs.

node.title: Target to accept food stamps for online food purchases

node.title: Synlait first-half revenue and sales volume largest on record

node.title: Refining NZ relaunches as Channel Infrastructure
node.description: Refining New Zealand has officially relaunched its business as Channel Infrastructure.

node.title: Defending champs England into World Cup final
node.description: Danni Wyatt scored her second one-day international century and Sophie Ecclestone took six wickets as champions England cruised into the World Cup final.

node.title: Record number of cranes in use around the motu
node.description: The booming construction sector has led to a record number of big cranes in use with demand expected to stay high.

node.title: Porsche and Audi under starters orders for F1
node.description: Audi and Porsche owner Volkswagen is set to give the green light for the two brands to make their entry into Formula One.

node.title: 'Great feedback': Half-price fares for public transport from today

node.title: 162,000 pounds of Skippy recalled due to metal fragments
node.description: Jars of Hormel Foods brand sold by major retailers may contain pieces of steel from manufacturing equipment.

node.title: Appetite grows on Capitol Hill for code of conduct for Supreme Court justices
node.description: "If your wife is an admitted and proud contributor to a coup of our country, maybe you should weigh that in your ethical standards," House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said Thursday.

node.title: All Whites one game away from World Cup
node.description: The All Whites are another step closer to the World Cup after winning the Oceania qualifying tournament.

node.title: Federal judge strikes down part of new Florida election law

node.title: Social Security to allow people to self-select their sex
node.description: The agency is "committed to reducing barriers and ensuring the fair treatment of the LGBTQ+ community," an official said.

node.title: Māori remain 'scared' despite shift on uplift of children - lawyer
node.description: The uplift of children from their families increased on average in the four months after the minister in charge ordered a step change. However, the overall trend is steeply down.

node.title: Here's who may still be eligible for stimulus checks
node.description: Some Americans may still be waiting for their third federal stimulus check, according to the Treasury Department.

node.title: Corporate America hasn't been this profitable since 1950

node.description: A suspect is in custody.

node.title: Will Smith refused to leave Oscars, academy says

node.title: Top UK judges resign from Hong Kong's highest court
